title: How Can We Prevent Gun Violence in Schools
text: The data utilized in this report was compiled by the Washington Post, comprising incidents of school shootings that have taken place in the United States following the Columbine High Massacre on April 20, 1999. It specifically focuses on shootings that occurred within primary and secondary school premises during regular school hours, excluding incidents at colleges and universities. These information have been collated through the use of news articles, open-source database, reports and information from both schools and police departments.

title: About
text:
This site plans to raise awareness on the issue of school shootings and propose ways to prevent these tragedies. The goal is to provide a comprehensive resource for anyone interested in learning more about this critical issue.
School shootings are a devastating reality that impact communities across the world. From heartbreaking losses to lasting trauma, the effects are profound and far reaching. Understanding the factors contributing to school shootings and exploring potential solutions are essential steps to creating a safer learning environment for children.

text:
Understanding the Crisis: The State of School Shootings
 
On April 20, 1999, the deadliest high school shooting occurred at that time in the United States, sparking a national debate on gun control. The Columbine High School shooting in Colorado left 15 people dead and 21 wounded. This tragic event served as a catalyst for heightened awareness and scrutiny of gun violence in schools, setting the stage for ongoing efforts to address the issue. Fast forward to the present day, the alarming rise in the number of school shootings in the United States has reached unprecedented levels, underscoring the urgent need for effective strategies to prevent these tragic incidents. In 2022 alone, the nation witnessed a staggering 46 school shootings, marking the highest number of recorded incidents since 1999. This statistic paints a grim picture of the pervasive threat of gun violence in educational settings and its devastating impact on students, teachers, and communities across the country.
According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), gun-related injuries have emerged as the leading cause of death among children and teens in the US. However, beyond the physical injuries, these incidents also inflict long-lasting psychological trauma on students who have directly experienced a school shooting. The prevalence of anxiety and trauma stemming from the threat of school shootings has not only compromised the well-being of students but also disrupted their academic learning through increased absenteeism and decline in studentsâ€™ academic performance following such incidents.

section: Addressing the Epidemic: Understanding Factors and Solutions
text:
Addressing the Epidemic: Understanding Factors and Solutions
As we confront the alarming rise in school shootings, it becomes imperative to understand the factors driving this disturbing trend and to explore effective strategies for prevention. Merely acknowledging the grim reality of these incidents is not enough; we must also delve deeper into the root causes, systemic failures, and societal factors that contribute to the epidemic of school shootings. By examining these factors, we can identify areas for intervention and develop evidence-based solutions to prevent further tragedies. So, what are the factors that have contributed to the rise in school shootings and what more can be done to prevent further occurrences?
